pullrequest.title: Created OperationalSpaceController plugin example that uses DART

content.raw:
If I understand @sloretz correctly, I think `can` here means `be able to`, but not `required`   
Then the name gives the sense that it is able to write to the output, but not forced to.      
While in the code now, we force it to have a `write`     

Maybe another way to put this: We `must` provide `write` method for `RequiredData`, while we can provide `write` method for `ExpectedData`    
The `may` or `must` is more closed tied to the data type   
As I am using this more with the ODE plugin, I totally get the point and it is not confusing me any more :)

While in the code now, we force it to have a write

Maybe another way to put this: We must provide write method for RequiredData, while we can provide write method for ExpectedData
The may or must is more closed tied to the data type
